laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood eosinophils increased to 16.6% and were consistently elevated, up to 42.4% on day 26.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Eosinophilic spongiform edema of the lesioned skin, eosinophilic microabscesses, liquefaction of the basal layer, and eosinophilic infiltration in the superficial dermis.

Diffuse multiple cystic and lamellar abnormal signal areas in the left frontal and parietal lobes; low signal in T1-weighted imaging, high signal in T2-weighted imaging; speckled diffusion restriction within the lesion; no abnormalities in sacrococcygeal MRI scan.

Diffuse hypodensity in the left cerebral hemisphere and bilateral cerebellum; large patchy hypodense area in the left frontoparietal lobe with a CT value of 10–15 HU; multiple speckled hyperintensities within it; widened left ventricle; additional patchy hyperintensities in the left cerebellar hemisphere.

Approximately 18.29 Mb mosaicism repeats in Yp11.31q11.222 region (16%); approximately 7.83 Mb mosaicism deletions in Yq11.222q11.23 region (17%); approximately 317.54 kb repeats in Yp11.2p11.2 region (copy number: 2) and 3p26.3p26.3 region with approximately 440.50 kb duplication (copy number 3).
Normal parental karyotype; brother was 46,X,del (Y)(q11.23) [7]/46,XY [93] with a mosaicism rate of 7%.
No pathogenic minor variants in the IKBKG gene.
No large deletion repeat variants in large segments of the IKBKG gene.
Did not find deletion variants in exons 4–10 of the IKBKG gene.
